claims_summary: CIA officer (1950-1975) specializing in Cuba operations and propaganda, stationed in Mexico City during Lee Harvey Oswald visit (1963), alleged Oswald handler investigated by HSCA

cia_career: CIA employment 1950-1975: Personnel records, retirement as Chief Western Hemisphere Division
Guatemala coup 1954: Operation PBSUCCESS documents show propaganda role
Bay of Pigs 1961: Propaganda chief documented in Taylor Commission report
JMWAVE station: Miami anti-Castro operations headquarters, Phillips documented role
Mexico City station 1963: CIA records place Phillips there during Oswald visit
oswald_connection_allegations: Antonio Veciana testimony: Alpha 66 leader claimed Phillips ('Maurice Bishop') introduced him to Oswald
Mexico City September 1963: Oswald visits Soviet and Cuban embassies while Phillips stationed there
HSCA investigation (1976-1978): Committee investigated Phillips-Oswald connection
Phillips denial: Testified he was not 'Maurice Bishop,' never met Oswald
HSCA conclusion: Could not definitively confirm or refute Veciana claims
Timing suspicious: Phillips in Mexico City during Oswald visit, two months before JFK assassination
propaganda_expertise: Cuba operations: Psychological operations, leaflets, radio broadcasts
Anti-Castro messaging: Coordination of exile group propaganda
Operational tradecraft: Use of aliases, compartmentation, agent recruitment
operation_40_allegations: Alleged assassination/regime change unit: Multiple sources claim existence
Phillips membership claimed: Disputed, no official confirmation
Cuban exile connections: Operation 40 allegedly included exile operatives
Violent operations: Unit allegedly conducted assassinations, sabotage
concealment: 'Maurice Bishop' alias: Never officially confirmed or denied
Mexico City records: Some files destroyed or remain classified
JFK assassination files: Phillips-related documents partially withheld
HSCA obstruction: Operational secrecy prevented full investigation
AFIO founding: Post-retirement, Phillips organized former intelligence officers

validation_status: CIA career well-documented through personnel records and declassified operations files - Oswald connection remains disputed with witness testimony but no definitive proof, HSCA investigation inconclusive
